p: Staphylococcus aureus is most commonly isolated from staphylococcosis cases, which is a Gram-positive, catalase-positive, and coccoid bacterium that appears in grape-like clusters on stained smears, but species such as S. hyicus have also been reported as the causative agent of osteomyelitis in Turkey poultry. Economic losses may result from decreased weight gain, decreased egg production, lameness, mortality, and condemnation at slaughter [ 19, 23, 24].
